HEADLINE: Pakistan Turns to El Salvador to Level Up Its Bitcoin Game
SUMMARY: The post Pakistan Turns to El Salvador to Level Up Its Bitcoin Game appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Pakistan is getting serious about crypto and wants to follow in El Salvador‚Äôs footsteps. This week, Bilal Bin Saqib, head of Pakistan‚Äôs Crypto Council and special advisor to the prime minister, visited El Salvador‚Äôs President Nayib Bukele to talk about Bitcoin adoption and building stronger crypto ties . Pakistan Following El Salvador Footsteps Bilal Bin Saqib, CEO of the Pakistan Crypto Council and State Minister for Crypto and Blockchain, recently met El Salvador‚Äôs President Nayib Bukele. After their meeting, Saqib praised Bukele as a ‚Äúvisionary‚Äù who backed Bitcoin when most world leaders were afraid to. Bukele was the first head of state to make Bitcoin legal tender, turning a small country into a symbol of innovation. Despite warnings from big global groups like the IMF, Bukele kept buying Bitcoin for his country. Just met one of the most extraordinary visionary leaders of our time, President of El Salvador, @nayibbukele A head of state who doesn‚Äôt just talk tech, but challenges it, from AI and robotics to Bitcoin. He‚Äôs a leader from the future, who saw the future first because when it‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/QpS6vVnTxv ‚Äî Bilal bin Saqib MBE (@Bilalbinsaqib) July 16, 2025 Meanwhile, today, El Salvador holds over 6,089 BTC, worth about $722 million . New Deal for Crypto Collaboration During the visit, Saqib and Bukele signed a Letter of Intent to work together. This agreement sets a plan for both countries to share ideas and work on Bitcoin projects. For Pakistan, the focus is on using crypto and blockchain to help more people access financial services and grow the digital economy But Bukele‚Äôs vision goes beyond Bitcoin. He is exploring AI, robotics, and emerging tech, proving you don‚Äôt need big resources to make a global impact, you need strong belief and bold decision Pakistan‚Äôs Plans Hit IMF Roadblock Pakistan has already tried to push ahead by using extra power to mine Bitcoin. Earlier this year, the government set aside 2,000 megawatts of spare electricity for crypto mining and AI centers. But the IMF did not support the plan, worried that cheap power for crypto could hurt the wider market. Recently, during the Bitcoin Conference in Las Vegas, Michael Saylor, founder of Strategy, praised Pakistan‚Äôs plan to build a national BTC reserve and stepped in to help build it.

HEADLINE: BlackRock just bought $916 million of these two cryptocurrencies
SUMMARY: BlackRock , the world‚Äôs largest asset manager, has quietly deepened its bet on Bitcoin ( BTC ), adding approximately $416 million worth of the cryptocurrency on July 16. BLACKROCK IS BUYING $BTC BlackRock just bought $416M of Bitcoin. Current Holdings: $85.47B BTC (3.6% of circulating supply) pic.twitter.com/Xer5d1R4XK ‚Äî Arkham (@arkham) July 16, 2025 According to on-chain data reviewed by Finbold, BlackRock‚Äôs total Bitcoin holdings surged from 694,100 BTC ($75.23B) on July 1 to 716,490 BTC ($84.34B) as of July 17. That‚Äôs an increase of 22,390 BTC, representing a 3.23% increase in holdings and a 12.11% jump in valuation over just 16 days. At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $117,710, up 8.61% during the same period, suggesting that BlackRock not only capitalized on price momentum but also actively accumulated into strength, contrary to typical institutional ‚Äúbuy-the-dip‚Äù narratives. A dominant BTC whale BlackRock now holds $85.47 billion in Bitcoin, representing roughly 3.6% of the current circulating supply of 19.89 million BTC, cementing its position as one of the most influential Bitcoin whales in the world, with holdings outpacing most sovereign wealth funds and crypto-native treasuries. The surge in holdings comes amid renewed institutional interest following geopolitical tensions, central bank rate stability, and the persistent demand for crypto ETFs, sectors where BlackRock remains a dominant player. Not just Bitcoin: ETH and more While Bitcoin took centre stage in BlackRock‚Äôs accumulation strategy, it wasn‚Äôt the only asset to see fresh inflows. The firm‚Äôs Ethereum ( ETH ) holdings jumped 17%, from 1.73 million ETH to 2.02 million ETH, adding over $2.5 billion in value. BlackRock‚Äôs latest purchase being $499.2 million ETH on July 16, with holdings now at $6.94 billion. BLACKROCK RECORD BUY: HALF A BILLION USD OF ETH BlackRock just set a new daily record, buying $499.2M ETH in one day yesterday. BlackRock currently holds $6.94 Billion USD of Ethereum. pic.twitter.com/o1c2mNal6D ‚Äî Arkham (@arkham) July 17, 2025 With the asset manager showing growing confidence in Ethereum‚Äôs Layer 2 and DeFi infrastructure as the blockchain gears up for its next scalability phase. BlackRock also made minor entries into micro-cap tokens like MOG and IMAGE, as well as increased its SPX exposure by nearly 19.4%, reflecting a broader strategy to diversify across correlated assets and memecoins with virality traction. Overall, BlackRock‚Äôs on-chain portfolio expanded over $12 billion between July 1 and July 17, 2025, rising from $79.55 billion to above $91 billion in just over two weeks. The post BlackRock just bought $916 million of these two cryptocurrencies appeared first on Finbold .

HEADLINE: El Salvador Signs Surprise Bitcoin (BTC) Deal! "They''re Also Talking With Michael Saylor!"
SUMMARY: Pakistan, which has been making bold moves regarding Bitcoin (BTC) and cryptocurrencies, has made a new move. Having announced that they will establish a Bitcoin reserve, Pakistan has now signed an agreement with El Salvador, the first country in the world to accept Bitcoin as legal tender. Bilal bin Saqib, Chairman of the Pakistan Cryptocurrency Council and advisor to the Prime Minister of Pakistan, recently met with El Salvador President Nayib Bukele to discuss the country''s Bitcoin strategy. The two sides signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to collaborate on Bitcoin adoption, inclusive finance, and policy development by the Pakistani government. Saqib, from his X account, described Bukele as one of the most extraordinary visionary leaders of the time and said: ‚ÄúPresident Bukele was a visionary who foresaw the future with unwavering faith, even when no one else supported Bitcoin. ‚ÄúEl Salvador is not only embracing innovation, it''s charting the course for the world.‚Äù Saqib also stated that Bukele was a futuristic leader who was the first to see the future of Bitcoin and stood with faith even when it was not cool to support BTC. ‚Äú‚Ä¶A head of state who doesn''t just talk about technology, but challenges technology in every field, from artificial intelligence to robotics to Bitcoin. A great example of how you don''t need abundant resources to put your country on the map, you just need vision and unwavering belief!‚Äù While this meeting is expected to see El Salvador and Pakistan further collaborate on Bitcoin, the Pakistan Cryptocurrency Council stated, ‚ÄúThis strategic collaboration reflects Pakistan''s desire to become a leader in the global digital asset economy.‚Äù The meeting with El Salvador President Nayib Bukele came a day after Pakistani Finance Minister Mohammed Aurangzeb and Saqib held a virtual meeting with Bitcoin bull Michael Saylor, founder of Strategy, which holds more than $62 billion in Bitcoin reserves. El Salvador, the first country in the world to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender in 2021, is currently known to have $745 million worth of Bitcoin. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: El Salvador Signs Surprise Bitcoin (BTC) Deal! "They''re Also Talking With Michael Saylor!"

HEADLINE: Bitcoin Trading: James Wynn‚Äôs Audacious 40x Short Position Sparks Market Buzz
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Trading: James Wynn‚Äôs Audacious 40x Short Position Sparks Market Buzz In the high-stakes world of Bitcoin trading , where fortunes can be made and lost in moments, a prominent move by Hyperliquid trader James Wynn has captured the attention of the crypto community. Known for his aggressive yet calculated strategies, Wynn recently closed a highly profitable long position on Bitcoin (BTC) and immediately pivoted, opening an audacious 40x crypto short position . This bold maneuver has ignited discussions across social media and trading desks, raising questions about market sentiment and the inherent risks and rewards of extreme leveraged trading . The Genesis of a Bold Move: James Wynn‚Äôs Profit and Pivot The saga began with James Wynn successfully concluding a 40x leveraged long position on Bitcoin, a trade that culminated in a remarkable profit of $368,120. This significant gain, as reported by Onchain Lens on X, underscores Wynn‚Äôs prowess in navigating volatile crypto markets. What makes his latest move particularly compelling is the immediate shift from a bullish stance to an aggressively bearish one. After securing his profits, Wynn wasted no time in establishing a new 40x BTC short position, signaling a strong conviction about Bitcoin‚Äôs immediate future trajectory. This rapid pivot from long to short, especially with such high leverage, is a testament to the dynamic nature of crypto markets and the decisive actions some traders take. It‚Äôs not just about making a profit; it‚Äôs about anticipating market shifts and positioning oneself accordingly, even if it means going against the prevailing sentiment. Understanding Leveraged Trading: Amplifying Gains and Risks Wynn‚Äôs 40x position highlights the powerful, yet perilous, nature of leveraged trading . But what exactly does ‚Äô40x leverage‚Äô mean, and why is it such a talked-about topic in the crypto space? What is Leveraged Trading? Leveraged trading allows traders to open positions larger than their actual capital. Essentially, you borrow funds from an exchange to amplify your potential returns. A 40x leverage means that for every $1 of your own capital, you can control $40 worth of an asset. While this can significantly boost profits, it equally magnifies potential losses. The Mechanics of Leverage: Margin: The initial capital you put up to open a leveraged position. Borrowed Funds: The additional capital provided by the exchange. Liquidation Price: A critical price point where your position is automatically closed by the exchange if the market moves too far against you, to prevent your losses from exceeding your margin. The higher the leverage, the closer your liquidation price is to your entry price. For a 40x position, even a small percentage move against the trader can lead to liquidation. This is why such high leverage is often considered extremely risky and is typically employed by experienced traders with robust risk management strategies. Why a Crypto Short Position? Deciphering Wynn‚Äôs Bearish Bet The decision by James Wynn to open a crypto short position on Bitcoin at 40x leverage speaks volumes about his current market outlook. Short selling, in essence, is a bet that an asset‚Äôs price will fall. Traders ‚Äòshort‚Äô an asset by borrowing it, selling it at the current market price, and then hoping to buy it back later at a lower price to return it to the lender, profiting from the price difference. Reasons for Short Selling Bitcoin: Bearish Market Outlook: The most direct reason is a belief that Bitcoin‚Äôs price is due for a correction or a significant decline. Hedging: Traders might short BTC to offset potential losses in their long-term spot holdings during a market downturn. Profit from Volatility: In highly volatile markets like crypto, short selling provides an opportunity to profit from downward price movements, complementing strategies focused on upward trends. Wynn‚Äôs immediate pivot to a short position suggests he anticipates a significant downturn, or at least a temporary dip, that he believes will be substantial enough to yield considerable profit even after accounting for funding rates and trading fees associated with high leverage. Hyperliquid: The Arena for High-Stakes Trading The platform of choice for James Wynn ‚Äòs high-leverage maneuvers is Hyperliquid . Hyperliquid is a decentralized perpetual exchange known for its high liquidity, low fees, and ability to offer substantial leverage to its users. Being a decentralized platform, it appeals to traders seeking more autonomy and potentially lower counterparty risk compared to centralized exchanges. The choice of Hyperliquid underscores the growing trend of sophisticated traders utilizing DeFi platforms for advanced trading strategies. These platforms often provide the infrastructure necessary for rapid execution and high leverage, catering to a niche of experienced and aggressive traders. What are the Implications and Risks of Such a Trade? A 40x crypto short position is not

HEADLINE: Tether in Trouble as GENIUS Act Targets USDT- Is a Market Collapse Ahead?
SUMMARY: The post Tether in Trouble as GENIUS Act Targets USDT- Is a Market Collapse Ahead? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News While the crypto is waiting anxiously for the upcoming crypto bills to hit the space. One analyst is expecting blood on the Satoshi Street once the GENIUS Act becomes the law. In this context, crypto analyst Jacob King sounded the alarm over what he calls the ‚Äúbloodiest event in Bitcoin‚Äôs modern history.‚Äù His warning centers on the potential banning of Tether (USDT) following the expected passage of the GENIUS Act, which he claims could trigger a massive collapse across the crypto market. Bitcoin is on the brink of its bloodiest event in modern history and no one is talking about it. Tether is about to be BANNED once the GENIUS Act passes the Senate. Why do you think they‚Äôve been desperately printing USDT out of thin air, pumping prices to unsustainable all-time‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Jacob King (@JacobKinge) July 16, 2025 Tether in the Crosshairs? According to analysts, the GENIUS Act, which is gaining traction in Congress, could effectively lead to a ban on Tether, the largest stablecoin by market cap. Despite the ban fear, Tether has recently minted 160 billion USDT, marking a major milestone and reinforcing its dominance in the stablecoin market. He argues that this threat is why Tether has been ‚Äúdesperately printing USDT out of thin air‚Äù in recent weeks to artificially inflate crypto prices, including Bitcoin‚Äôs. Tether has long faced criticism for its lack of transparency and allegations of unbacked printing, though it has continued to deny wrongdoing. Institutional Outflows Signal Trouble King also points to a wave of record ETF outflows this week, stating that institutions are quietly exiting their Bitcoin positions. He sees this as a major red flag, suggesting that ‚Äúwhales are abandoning the sinking ship‚Äù while retail investors remain unaware of the looming risk. Tether Insiders Dumping Bitcoin? In a further claim, King says that Tether insiders are offloading record amounts of Bitcoin through OTC (over-the-counter) trades, distancing themselves from the fallout before it begins. If true, this could mean major players are shedding risk while keeping the market unaware of the scale of exits. A Structural Collapse? King‚Äôs core argument is that Tether is the foundation propping up Bitcoin. He estimates that 85‚Äì90% of BTC‚Äôs daily volume is dependent on USDT, which he calls ‚Äúfake volume.‚Äù Without Tether, he warns, ‚Äúpeople will realize how fake everything has been.‚Äù In his view, the crypto market is built on fragile ground, and the removal of Tether could expose the entire system to collapse. While King‚Äôs post paints a bleak scenario, it‚Äôs important to note that his views are controversial and not supported by hard evidence in this thread. Still, his warning is sparking serious debate about stablecoin regulation and the real liquidity behind crypto markets, issues that could come into sharper focus as U.S. lawmakers push forward with crypto legislation. How True is this? While the warning highlights crypto‚Äôs volatility, it also opens the door for new players like Ripple‚Äôs RLUSD to gain ground. The GENIUS Act doesn‚Äôt ban Tether outright but gives it 18‚Äì36 months to comply. Contrary to panic, ETF data shows inflows, not outflows. Overall, the market remains shaky, but there‚Äôs no clear sign of an imminent ‚Äúbloodbath.‚Äù

HEADLINE: Ripple‚Äôs XRP Failed in January: Can It Succeed in July?
SUMMARY: TL;DR There‚Äôs something in the cryptocurrency air in the past week or so, as bitcoin broke out of consolidation, marched to a new all-time high, and brought the entire market with it. Ripple‚Äôs cross-border token is among the biggest beneficiaries of this rally, having surged to well beyond $3 and close to its all-time high of $3.4. But can it finally do it now? The Rise Just look at the graph above, which paints a vivid picture of XRP‚Äôs massive run experienced lately. The asset had fallen below $2 at the end of June (not that long ago, right?) during the darkest hours of the Israel-Iran conflict. However, it quickly bounced above it and returned to a familiar ground of $2.2-$2.3, which was a tight range in which it spent most of the past few months. Fast-forward to last Wednesday, the landscape was relatively uneventful and, some might say, boring, as XRP was rangebound within this consolidation phase, with little to no indication of a clear breakout, despite some big predictions . However, the cryptocurrency market was revived as mentioned above, led by BTC‚Äôs massive $15,000 surge to a new all-time high of over $123,000. Not only did XRP follow suit, but it managed to dwarf bitcoin‚Äôs impressive gains. The largest cryptocurrency is up by 6.7% weekly, while the third-biggest has shot up by 33%. Earlier today, the asset jumped to $3.25, thus coming around 4.5% away from its January 2018 peak of $3.4 (CoinGecko data). To put things into perspective, XRP has gained over 70% since the aforementioned bottom in June (less than a month ago). Can There Be New ATH? Although impressive, this run has not been an isolated incident for XRP. Recall that the cryptocurrency rallied hard in late 2024 and early 2025, and its culmination came in January when it matched its all-time high of $3.4. However, it couldn‚Äôt keep climbing into uncharted territory despite the community‚Äôs expectations. Consequently, we decided to ask ChatGPT about the current environment and its opinion on XRP‚Äôs chances for a new record now. The AI solution noted that even though Ripple‚Äôs native token is so close to its ATH, a breach above it is not as easy and simple as some might think. This is because the $3.4 level has become a ‚Äúpsychological and technical ceiling for over seven years.‚Äù ‚ÄúXRP was rejected there in January, indicating it‚Äôs a sticky level.‚Äù On the contrary, ChatGPT listed a few favorable indicators that could propel the asset to and beyond that level. The RSI is still below 70, which means it ‚Äúmay still have room to move up.‚Äù Additionally, there are lots of bullish factors outside of technical analysis, such as ETF momentum , ISO 20022 update narrative, and overall market sentiment, that could lead to new peaks. If it indeed manages to break through, analysts are adamant that the next target will be around $4.80. The post Ripple‚Äôs XRP Failed in January: Can It Succeed in July? appeared first on CryptoPotato .

HEADLINE: UK Ministers Consider Ban on Crypto Donations Over Foreign Interference Fears
SUMMARY: Ministers in the United Kingdom are considering a ban on cryptocurrency donations to political parties, citing concerns about traceability and the potential for foreign interference in domestic elections. Pat McFadden, a Cabinet Office minister, raised the issue on Tuesday, emphasizing the need for public trust in the funding of political activities. McFadden responded to a question from Labour party member Liam Byrne, stating that the UK should ensure its laws remain updated to safeguard the integrity of its democratic processes. ‚ÄúThe funding of democracy is often a controversial area, but it‚Äôs very important that we know who is providing the donation, whether they are properly registered, and what the bona fides of that donation are,‚Äù McFadden noted, supporting the idea of a potential ban. Crypto Donations Raise Transparency Questions The discussion comes at a time when crypto donations have been gaining traction in the United States , with President Donald Trump openly accepting contributions in digital assets. In contrast, the UK‚Äôs cautious stance reflects a growing divide in global approaches to crypto‚Äôs role in politics. The debate in the UK intensified after Nigel Farage‚Äôs Reform UK party declared it would accept political donations in Bitcoin, becoming the first UK party to do so. Meanwhile, an anti-corruption nonprofit in the UK recently published a report warning that crypto donations could increase the risk of funds from criminal sources or foreign entities entering the political system, potentially leading to ‚Äúfuture political interference schemes.‚Äù Both McFadden and Byrne suggested that strengthening the UK‚Äôs National Crime Agency and the Electoral Commission could help address the concerns around crypto‚Äôs influence on politics while maintaining transparency in political funding. Global Pushback on Crypto Contributions The UK joins other countries and regions that are re-evaluating crypto‚Äôs place in campaign finance. In 2022, Ireland enacted a ban on all crypto donations to political entities, aiming to protect its democracy from foreign interference while also tackling misinformation and transparency issues. In the United States, several states, including Oregon, Michigan, and North Carolina, have banned crypto donations to political campaigns due to similar concerns, despite the growing popularity of digital assets in campaign fundraising. El Salvador, which has adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, does not ban crypto donations, although civic groups there have warned about the potential for anonymous foreign or criminal influence in its elections. As crypto donations continue to rise globally , lawmakers face the challenge of closing regulatory gaps while balancing innovation with the need to protect democratic systems from opaque and potentially harmful financial influences. The post UK Ministers Consider Ban on Crypto Donations Over Foreign Interference Fears appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

Crypto Donations Raise Transparency Questions The discussion comes at a time when crypto donations have been gaining traction in the United States , with President Donald Trump openly accepting contributions in digital assets. In contrast, the UK‚Äôs cautious stance reflects a growing divide in global approaches to crypto‚Äôs role in politics. The debate in the UK intensified after Nigel Farage‚Äôs Reform UK party declared it would accept political donations in Bitcoin, becoming the first UK party to do so. Meanwhile, an anti-corruption nonprofit in the UK recently published a report warning that crypto donations could increase the risk of funds from criminal sources or foreign entities entering the political system, potentially leading to ‚Äúfuture political interference schemes.‚Äù Both McFadden and Byrne suggested that strengthening the UK‚Äôs National Crime Agency and the Electoral Commission could help address the concerns around crypto‚Äôs influence on politics while maintaining transparency in political funding. Global Pushback on Crypto Contributions The UK joins other countries and regions that are re-evaluating crypto‚Äôs place in campaign finance. In 2022, Ireland enacted a ban on all crypto donations to political entities, aiming to protect its democracy from foreign interference while also tackling misinformation and transparency issues. In the United States, several states, including Oregon, Michigan, and North Carolina, have banned crypto donations to political campaigns due to similar concerns, despite the growing popularity of digital assets in campaign fundraising. El Salvador, which has adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, does not ban crypto donations, although civic groups there have warned about the potential for anonymous foreign or criminal influence in its elections. As crypto donations continue to rise globally , lawmakers face the challenge of closing regulatory gaps while balancing innovation with the need to protect democratic systems from opaque and potentially harmful financial influences. HEADLINE: Whales and hackers are winning the Ethereum pump
SUMMARY: Ethereum (ETH) is riding on a huge bullish wave, smashing all the highly anticipated price levels. ETH just smashed past $3,400 mark, looking to get over $3,500 now, and whales can‚Äôt keep calm. The largest altcoin price has jumped by 23% over the last 7 days. The ongoing Ethereum price surge has grabbed the attention from Bitcoin‚Äôs ATH rally and triggered sentiments of altcoin season in the market. Bitcoin price dropped to below the $118K level after hitting a fresh ATH of above $123K. The global digital assets market cap surged by 1.5% over the last day to stand at $3.81 trillion. Trump buys, hacker sells According to the data shared by Lookonchain, Donald Trump‚Äôs World Liberty Financial (WLF) splashed $10 million USDC to buy 3,007 ETH at an average of $3,326. The fund has been hoarding ETH since November, now sitting on 70,505 ETH worth $230 million, with a neat $7 million in paper gains. It added that from November 29, 2024, to March 5, 2025, WLF has accumulated 66,275 Ethereum (approx. worth $215 million) at an average price of $3,243. They‚Äôre not alone as SharpLink Gaming also jumped in. In just 5 hours, they vacuumed up 20,279 ETH (approx. worth $68.38 million). This move brings their 8-day binge to 111,609 ETH (worth $343 million). However, a mysterious whale 0x35fb resurfaced and scooped 7,980 ETH from Kraken. This whale has been busy buying 88,292 ETH in the last week alone. That‚Äôs nearly $300 million drifting off exchanges. This suggests that someone‚Äôs getting ready for something big or knows something we don‚Äôt. Meanwhile, not every whale is swimming upstream as two major players have dumped a combined 178,080 ETH (approx. worth $528 million). Trend Research, which bought 184,115 ETH between February and June at $2,118 average, just cashed out 79,470 ETH for $250 million. They still hold 105,664 Ethereum. Then there‚Äôs the whale who made $30 million in past ETH trades. It bought over 132K ETH during June‚Äôs dip and is now cashing out fast, unloading 98K ETH since the pump began. The whale still got 35K ETH on standby, though. Source: Lookonchain . Even hackers are going all out. Remember the Infini exploit from February‚Äîthe attacker who looted $49.5M and spent it on 17,696 ETH at $2,798. As ETH‚Äôs price jumped, its holdings ballooned to $59.6 million. He just sold 1,770 ETH for nearly $6 million. ETH ETFs had their best day ever This spike is not Whales‚Äô game only, as ETH linked ETFs reported their best day ever. On Wednesday alone, they pulled in a record $726.74 million in net inflows, and now total ETH ETF assets top $16.41 billion. BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA led with nearly $500 million while Fidelity‚Äôs FETH stood second with $113 million of inflow. Ethereum price is up 22% this month, and running up by 117% over the last 90 days. Meanwhile, we haven‚Äôt even broken the all-time high yet. The ETF effect is real, as July‚Äôs inflows have already hit $2.27 billion, the highest since these funds launched last year. ETH is trading at an average price of $3,463 at press time. Its 24-hour trading volume spiked by 34% to stand at $51 billion. HEADLINE: Coinbase Unveils ‚ÄòSuper App‚Äô To Expand Crypto Access‚ÄìDetails
SUMMARY: Crypto exchange Coinbase has launched a new initiative with its ‚ÄúBase App,‚Äù aiming to broaden access to the crypto economy. Unveiled on Wednesday, this application replaces the Coinbase Wallet and is designed to merge various functionalities, including wallet, trading, payments, messaging, and social media. Built on Coinbase‚Äôs proprietary blockchain network, Base, which operates on the Ethereum (ETH) blockchain, the app reportedly seeks to attract a wider audience beyond traditional cryptocurrency enthusiasts. Base App Launch According to CNBC, the Base App represents an opportunity to reach consumers who may not be primarily interested in buying or trading cryptocurrencies‚Äîa critical pivot given the company‚Äôs past over-reliance on trading revenues. Related Reading: BNB Price Stalls: Struggles to Resume Gains While Altcoins Rally To support the launch of the Base App, Coinbase introduced two significant features: Base Account, an identity verification system, and Base Pay, an express checkout tool designed for payments using the Circle-issued USDC stablecoin. During the unveiling event, Alex Danco, a product manager at Shopify, highlighted that ‚Äútens of thousands‚Äù of merchants can now utilize this feature, with plans for a broader rollout in the coming months. Additionally, Shopify intends to offer 1% cash back on USDC payments made through Base, further incentivizing usage. While initial enthusiasm for the Base network has primarily attracted developers and builders, notable interest is growing among larger financial entities. Recently, JPMorgan announced its plan to launch a deposit token on the Base blockchain, showcasing the network‚Äôs potential. Ambitious Goals For Coinbase The Base App is designed to enhance monetization options and greater control over their identity and data. As part of this initiative, Coinbase plans to fund creator rewards and waive USDC transaction fees within chat features, although significant revenue generation is not expected immediately. This launch comes at a time when the broader cryptocurrency industry is experiencing a surge in new products, driven by favorable policies from the Trump administration and anticipated regulatory clarity from Congress. Related Reading: Altcoin Season Index Spikes Above 30, But Bitcoin Dominance Remains High, What Next? Last month, Coinbase made headlines with the introduction of its first credit card in partnership with American Express, while Shopify rolled out USDC-powered payment solutions through Coinbase and Stripe. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong has expressed ambitious goals for the company, aiming to position USDC as the world‚Äôs leading stablecoin, currently dominated by Tether‚Äôs USDT. He also envisions transforming Coinbase into the premier financial services app globally within the next five to ten years. As of writing, the exchange‚Äôs stock, COIN, is trading at $398, slightly down from its all-time high of $405, which was reached earlier in Wednesday‚Äôs trading session. Bitcoin (BTC) and other major cryptocurrencies have also shown significant bullish momentum, with prices reaching new records or levels not seen since earlier in the year. Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com

HEADLINE: WazirX Users Could Finally Get Funds Back As Court Reverses Ruling
SUMMARY: The Singapore High Court has reversed its earlier ruling, paving the way for a WazirX revote that could lead to user crypto distribution. WazirX Given Greenlight By Court For Revote In a new post on X, Indian crypto exchange WazirX has shared details of the Singapore High Court hearing held on July 16th. The court has set aside its earlier rejection of the platform‚Äôs restructuring proposal and has approved a fast-tracked revote that could allow the exchange to open back up. WazirX closed its doors almost exactly a year ago, on July 18th, after falling prey to a notorious hack that drained it of user crypto funds amounting to $234 million. At the time, the exchange held about $500 million in its reserves, meaning almost half of its assets were wiped out. The hack was later linked with North Korean hackers part of the Lazarus Group . When the breach became known, the exchange suspended deposits and withdrawals, and to this day, these channels haven‚Äôt been reopened, although that may be about to change. WazirX has been planning a restructure through its parent company Zettai PTE LTD and during a vote, the proposal ended up finding overwhelming support from the creditors. The Singapore High Court rejected the plan during a hearing on June 4th, however, citing concerns over regulatory compliance with Singapore‚Äôs Financial Services and Markets Act (FSMA) and the involvement of Panama-based entity Zensui in the distribution process. The company amended the proposal and returned to court again. After the latest hearing, the Singapore High Court has now given its greenlight on the updated plan and allow the exchange to conduct a fast-tracked revote with its creditors. Alongside the news, Nischal Shetty , CEO of WazirX, has broken a long silence on X to comment on the outcome. ‚ÄúThe broad amendment is that instead of Zettai, it will be Zanmai helping with the fund distribution if the scheme is approved,‚Äù noted Shetty. Zanmai Labs is the Indian entity behind WazirX that manages the Indian Rupee (INR) component of the platform. Zettai, on the other hand, was the one looking after the crypto side of things, which is why the firm has been at the center of the legal proceedings. The data of the vote will be announced soon, according to Shetty. ‚ÄúIf the amended scheme is approved by the requisite majority of creditors and sanctioned by the court, it is contemplated that the WazirX platform will reopen,‚Äù said WazirX in the announcement. It now remains to be seen how things will develop from here and whether the platform‚Äôs users who have been waiting for their crypto for over a year will finally get it back. Bitcoin Price At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading around $119,300, up over 8% in the last week.

HEADLINE: Altcoin Season Index Plummets to 38: Decoding Bitcoin‚Äôs Dominance in the Crypto Market
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Altcoin Season Index Plummets to 38: Decoding Bitcoin‚Äôs Dominance in the Crypto Market The cryptocurrency world is constantly shifting, and understanding these shifts is crucial for any investor. Recently, a key indicator, the Altcoin Season Index , has dropped to 38, signaling a significant period for the market. This isn‚Äôt just a number; it‚Äôs a clear message that we are currently deep into what‚Äôs known as Bitcoin Season, a time when the king of crypto asserts its dominance over the myriad of alternative coins. What does this mean for your portfolio, and how should you navigate these prevailing crypto market trends ? Understanding the Altcoin Season Index : What Does 38 Mean? To truly grasp the current state of the market, it‚Äôs essential to understand the metric guiding our insights: the Altcoin Season Index. This valuable tool, meticulously tracked by the cryptocurrency price data platform CoinMarketCap (CMC), provides a snapshot of the broader market sentiment and asset performance. On July 17, at 00:30 UTC, the index registered a reading of 38, a figure that remained unchanged from the previous day. This low number is a direct indicator of the market‚Äôs current leanings. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of how this index works and what its current reading signifies: Exclusions: The index specifically filters out stablecoins (like USDT or USDC) and wrapped tokens (like wBTC) to provide a clearer picture of genuine market sentiment and speculative asset performance. Comparison Basis: It meticulously compares the performance of the top 100 cryptocurrencies listed on CoinMarketCap over the past 90 days. This 90-day window offers a robust view, smoothing out daily volatility to reveal underlying trends. Defining Seasons: The index has clear thresholds for determining market seasons: Altcoin Season: For the market to be declared in Altcoin Season, a remarkable 75% or more of these top 100 altcoins must have outperformed Bitcoin over the 90-day period. This signifies broad-based altcoin strength. Bitcoin Season: Conversely, Bitcoin Season is declared when 25% or fewer of the top 100 altcoins manage to outperform Bitcoin. A score of 38, as we see now, falls squarely within this range, indicating that Bitcoin is largely overshadowing its smaller counterparts. Score Range: The index operates on a scale from 1 to 100, with higher numbers indicating stronger altcoin performance relative to Bitcoin, and lower numbers signaling Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance. A score of 38 emphatically confirms that Bitcoin has been the dominant force, soaking up capital and attention, while most altcoins struggle to keep pace. Navigating Bitcoin Season : Why Dominance Matters When the Altcoin Season Index points towards Bitcoin Season, it‚Äôs not just an academic observation; it has tangible implications for the entire market. Bitcoin Season typically occurs for several reasons, and understanding them can help investors make more informed decisions. During a Bitcoin Season: Flight to Safety: In times of uncertainty or market consolidation, investors often view Bitcoin as the safest bet in the volatile crypto space. Its larger market capitalization, established infrastructure, and first-mover advantage make it a preferred store of value. Capital tends to flow out of riskier altcoins and into Bitcoin. Halving Cycles: Bitcoin‚Äôs halving events, which reduce the supply of new BTC, historically precede bull runs. The anticipation and post-halving effects often lead to Bitcoin outperforming altcoins as investors front-run or react to the supply shock. Institutional Interest: A growing number of institutional investors are entering the crypto space, and many start with Bitcoin due to its liquidity and regulatory clarity (or perceived clarity compared to altcoins). This influx of institutional capital disproportionately benefits Bitcoin. Liquidity Concentration: As Bitcoin gains momentum, trading volume often concentrates around BTC pairs, making it easier for large players to enter and exit positions without significant price slippage. This further reinforces its dominance. The current Bitcoin Season means that, for the vast majority of the top 100 altcoins, their performance has lagged behind Bitcoin‚Äôs over the last three months. This isn‚Äôt necessarily a sign of weakness in altcoins themselves, but rather a reflection of Bitcoin‚Äôs superior momentum and market preference during this specific period. Analyzing Crypto Market Trends : Beyond the Index While the Altcoin Season Index provides a quantitative measure, it‚Äôs crucial to look at broader crypto market trends to understand the full picture. The index is a symptom, not the sole cause, of market dynamics. Several macroeconomic and industry-specific factors contribute to the current state of Bitcoin dominance. Consider these overarching trends: Global Economic Headwinds: High inflation, rising interest rates, and geopolitical tensions can lead investors to de-risk. In the crypto space, this often transla

HEADLINE: Litecoin price prediction 2025-2031: Will LTC recover to $200 soon?
SUMMARY: Key Takeaways: Litecoin‚Äôs price faces bullish volatility around $100 Our Litecoin price prediction for 2025 expects the maximum price of LTC to be $201. In 2030, we expect Litecoin to attain a maximum of $1,228. Following Bitcoin‚Äôs move toward $100K, Litecoin faced increasing buying activity. This surge in activity raises several questions for investors: Is it a good time to invest in Litecoin? Or Will Litecoin (LTC) hold above $200 in 2025? These are common questions that make predicting Litecoin‚Äôs price a bit tricky. We have prepared a detailed analysis and forecast of Litecoin price prediction from 2025 to 2031 to assist you with these questions. HEADLINE: Mysterious Bitcoin Whale Strikes Again! Thousands of Bitcoin Moved to a Different Address! Is a Sale Coming?
SUMMARY: The ‚ÄúOG Bitcoin whale,‚Äù considered one of the crypto world''s oldest and most mysterious asset holders, is back on the move after 14 years of silence. ‚ÄúOG Bitcoin Whale‚Äù Awakes After 14 Years, Moves Another 40,000 BTC: Is He Preparing to Sell? According to blockchain data, 40,192 BTC (approximately $4.75 billion) was transferred from whale addresses to a new address early this morning. This mysterious whale first moved approximately 80,000 BTC ($9.5 billion) across eight different addresses on July 4, 2025. These transfers, each containing 10,000 BTC, caused a stir in the crypto community. Two days earlier, 40,010 of these BTC were sent to two addresses identified by chain analysis firm Arkham as belonging to Galaxy Digital. Some of the funds were later distributed to crypto exchange OKX and unlabeled addresses. The remainder remains held in Galaxy Digital addresses. New Transfer: Sell Signal? As of 4:33 AM today, the remaining 40,192 BTC, previously distributed equally across four different addresses (‚Äúbc1qn‚Äù, ‚Äúbc1qy‚Äù, ‚Äúbc1qm‚Äù, ‚Äú1GcCK‚Äù), were consolidated into a new address (‚Äúbc1qs‚Ä¶‚Äù). Prior to the transfer, test transactions of 1 BTC were conducted on Tuesday and Wednesday. According to analytics firm Lookonchain, this new consolidation move could indicate the whale is planning to continue selling. Galaxy Digital‚Äôs OTC (over-the-counter) services allow users to sell large amounts of crypto privately without sending them directly to exchanges. Who Could Be the Whale? While various theories circulate regarding the identity of this mysterious whale, from Roger Ver to the CIA and even Satoshi Nakamoto, Coinbase executive Conor Grogan states that the whale was likely an early Bitcoin miner in 2011. At the time, the block reward was 50 BTC and there was much less competition on the network. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Mysterious Bitcoin Whale Strikes Again! Thousands of Bitcoin Moved to a Different Address! Is a Sale Coming?

HEADLINE: Former NCA officer bags 5-year sentence for stealing Silk Road BTC
SUMMARY: A former NCA officer got sentenced to five and a half years in prison after admitting he stole 50 BTC (currently worth around ¬£4.4‚ÄØmillion) seized as part of a crackdown on illegal dark web marketplaces. Paul‚ÄØChowles, 42, is an ex-NCA officer who worked with the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) to target organized criminals operating on the Silk Road in 2013. That first operation led to drug convictions for several UK suspects. A picture of Paul Chowles. Source: CPS UK NCA officer moved Silk Road BTC In 2014, investigators launched a 2nd phase that uncovered ‚ÄúSilk Road‚ÄØ2.0,‚Äù set up by Thomas White within one month of the FBI‚Äôs closure of the Silk Road. White later received a 64-month prison sentence in April‚ÄØ2019. In that team, Chowles was responsible for analyzing and extracting crypto and data from White‚Äôs devices. According to the records, 50 BTC out of 97 BTC taken from White‚Äôs ‚Äúretirement wallet‚Äù were moved in two large transfers to another public address from May 6 ‚Äì 7, 2017. Those coins were then split into smaller sums and run through ‚ÄúBitcoin Fog,‚Äù a known money‚Äëlaundering mixer, before being transferred to other wallets to obscure their origin. Once the trail was blurred, Chowles converted some of the BTC into pounds and withdrew cash. He also set up accounts with Cryptopay and Wirex, using their debit cards to spend and withdraw funds. From August 26, 2021, until May‚ÄØ20, 2022. He made 279 purchases totaling ¬£23,309 on his Cryptopay card. He also made five cash withdrawals amounting to ¬£6,232 from August 30, 2021 until February‚ÄØ22, 2022. Meanwhile, his Wirex card racked up transactions adding up to ¬£79,884.77 from August 27, 2021 to July 14, 2021. The flow of stolen BTC. Source: Chainalysis Altogether, Chowles profited by ¬£613,147.29 from his criminal actions, according to the investigators. Today, the market value of the total stolen BTC exceeds ¬£4.4‚ÄØmillion. Chowles confessed to his crime at Liverpool Crown Court in May 2025. He pleaded guilty to various charges, including thievery and transfers and concealment of criminal funds. Finally, he received a sentence of 5.5 years on July 16. White helped nab Paul Chowles After White‚Äôs 97‚ÄØBitcoins were seized, investigators first thought he had removed the 50‚ÄØtokens by himself. By late 2021, the missing Bitcoins were written off as lost. Later, during investigations, White pointed out that only someone inside the NCA with access to his private keys could have taken the missing coins. Merseyside officers, who manage White‚Äôs license, met NCA colleagues, including Chowles, to review the case. It was at that meeting that their attention turned towards the stolen 50‚ÄØBitcoins. An investigation by Merseyside Police followed, leading to Chowles‚Äôs arrest. Officers seized his iPhone, linking him to the transfer account, and showed browser history for a crypto exchange. They also found notebooks in his office containing details such as statements, usernames, and passwords, tied to White‚Äôs accounts. According to specialist prosecutor Alex Johnson, Chowles was someone with a competent and technical mind who had great knowledge of crypto and the dark net. Johnson added, ‚ÄúHe abused that trust to fill his own pockets.‚Äù KEY Difference Wire : the secret tool crypto projects use to get guaranteed media coverage

HEADLINE: Abraxas Capital Faces Staggering $131M Loss on Crypto Shorts
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Abraxas Capital Faces Staggering $131M Loss on Crypto Shorts The world of cryptocurrency trading is often described as a wild west, full of immense opportunities and equally immense risks. This sentiment has been starkly highlighted by recent revelations surrounding Abraxas Capital , a firm now reportedly grappling with a colossal financial setback. On-chain analytics platform Onchain Lens, a prominent voice in the crypto community, recently dropped a bombshell on X (formerly Twitter): two Hyperliquid addresses, strongly suspected to be linked to Abraxas Capital, are holding a portfolio of short positions across various cryptocurrencies, accumulating more than $131 million in unrealized losses . This isn‚Äôt just a ripple; it‚Äôs a significant wave that sends shivers down the spines of traders and investors alike, underscoring the precarious nature of high-stakes crypto ventures. What Exactly Are Unrealized Losses and Short Positions? To truly grasp the gravity of Abraxas Capital‚Äôs situation, it‚Äôs crucial to understand the fundamental concepts at play: short selling and the distinction between realized and unrealized losses . Imagine you believe the price of an asset, say Bitcoin, is going to fall. In traditional investing, you‚Äôd simply avoid buying it. But in the world of short selling, you can actually profit from a price decline. Short Selling Mechanics: To short an asset, you typically borrow it from a broker or exchange, sell it at the current market price, and then wait for its price to drop. If your prediction is correct, you then buy the asset back at a lower price and return it to the lender, pocketing the difference. It sounds simple, but the risks are profound. The Peril of Unlimited Loss: While the profit potential in shorting is limited (an asset can only fall to zero), the loss potential is theoretically unlimited. If the asset‚Äôs price rises instead of falls, you‚Äôre still obligated to buy it back and return it, meaning you‚Äôll have to purchase it at a higher price than you sold it for. The higher it goes, the more you lose. Unrealized vs. Realized Losses: This is a critical distinction. An unrealized loss is a paper loss; it exists as long as the position is open and the market moves against you. It‚Äôs the difference between your entry price and the current market price. A realized loss, however, occurs when you close the position, locking in that loss. Abraxas Capital‚Äôs reported $131 million is an unrealized loss, meaning they haven‚Äôt yet closed these positions, but they are deep in the red based on current market prices. This also implies they might be facing significant margin calls, where they need to deposit more collateral to maintain their positions, or risk forced liquidation. The sheer scale of these unrealized losses underscores the extreme volatility inherent in the crypto market, where prices can swing wildly in short periods, making crypto short positions particularly perilous. The On-Chain Revelation: How On-Chain Analytics Uncovered the Story In the transparent yet often opaque world of decentralized finance (DeFi), on-chain analytics platforms serve as powerful investigative tools. Onchain Lens, in this instance, demonstrated the immense value they bring to the crypto ecosystem. But how do they do it? Public Ledgers, Private Identities: Blockchain transactions are public, recorded on an immutable ledger. Every transfer, every trade, every loan is visible. What often remains private, however, is the identity behind the wallet addresses. The Art of De-Anonymization: On-chain analytics firms like Onchain Lens specialize in de-anonymizing these addresses. They use sophisticated algorithms, heuristics, and often, publicly available information (like previous statements from firms about their wallet addresses, or large, identifiable movements of funds to and from known entities) to link specific addresses to real-world entities or individuals. While they haven‚Äôt publicly detailed their methodology for linking these specific Hyperliquid addresses to Abraxas Capital, it likely involves tracing funds, identifying patterns, or leveraging previously known associations. Transparency in Action: This incident highlights the double-edged sword of blockchain transparency. While it offers unparalleled visibility into market movements and financial flows, it also exposes the positions and sometimes the missteps of large players. For investors and the broader market, this transparency can be invaluable for understanding market dynamics and identifying potential risks or opportunities. The ability of on-chain analytics to shed light on such significant financial positions underscores a paradigm shift in financial scrutiny, moving from traditional regulatory oversight to a more decentralized, community-driven form of accountability. Hyperliquid and the Risky Bet: A Deep Dive into the Platform The reported short positions were held on Hyperliquid, a decentralized perpetuals exchange. This cho

Transparency in Action: This incident highlights the double-edged sword of blockchain transparency. While it offers unparalleled visibility into market movements and financial flows, it also exposes the positions and sometimes the missteps of large players. For investors and the broader market, this transparency can be invaluable for understanding market dynamics and identifying potential risks or opportunities. The ability of on-chain analytics to shed light on such significant financial positions underscores a paradigm shift in financial scrutiny, moving from traditional regulatory oversight to a more decentralized, community-driven form of accountability. HEADLINE: Burchett and Trump agree on private crypto transactions
SUMMARY: US Representative Tim Burchett says they agreed with President Trump to maintain the anonymity of crypto transactions, similar to how cash works. In a Thursday X post, the Tennessee representative commented , ‚ÄúLate night agreement with ‚Å¶Donald Trump‚Å© and leadership to keep your crypto transactions private like cash.‚Äù Crypto bills stalled in the House after some Republicans moved to support Democrats Lately, the Trump administration and Republican representatives have been focused on setting friendly regulations for the industry. This week, the so-called ‚Äúcrypto week,‚Äù the House was slated to advance three bills endorsed by President Trump, who argued they would propel the US to be the global crypto capital. However, Tuesday‚Äôs legislative push hit a snag as some Republicans joined Democrats to stop the procedural vote. Though Trump weighed in during a late evening meeting with GOP members at the White House, seemingly reviving the bills. He posted on Truth Social that he expected the bills to come up for a vote by Wednesday. Late night agreement with ‚Å¶ @realDonaldTrump ‚Å© and leadership to keep your crypto transactions private like cash. pic.twitter.com/ILXouDofWO ‚Äî Tim Burchett (@timburchett) July 17, 2025 Still, Republicans were grappling with internal divisions in their Wednesday discussions. Conservative republicans held out, demanding that the crypto market structure bill explicitly ban the Federal Reserve from creating a digital dollar. Burchett, one of the GOP hardliners, said they were under the impression an agreement had been made to satisfy their demands, but it soon fell through. He noted that some wanted the agreement in writing, and others didn‚Äôt agree with the deal. He added, ‚ÄúSo you‚Äôve got people that are just upset.‚Äù GOP hardliners were pushing to merge the crypto market structure bill, the CLARITY Act , with the other bill to ban a central digital currency. However, a pro-crypto Democrat warned that combining the two bills might cost crucial Democratic support and risk their passage in the Senate. Nevertheless, House Republicans advanced the three crypto bills and the 2026 defense spending plan despite tense negotiations. Republican leaders agreed to include a CBDC ban in the must-pass defense authorization bill, securing support from GOP hardliners. President Trump seemed pleased with the agreement they made. Speaker Mike Johnson also expressed his relief that the stalemate was finally over. The House has now cleared a procedural hurdle that opens the door to passing crypto legislation. Johnson expects to take up the Senate‚Äôs stablecoin legislation, the GENIUS Act, on Thursday, while action on the CLARITY bill may be delayed. The GENIUS Act, if approved, will move on to Trump‚Äôs desk and become the first major crypto bill ever passed by Congress. The crypto community shows mixed reactions to Burchett‚Äôs post Nonetheless, the administration seems open to discussing more digital assets. Burchett claimed they agreed with Trump to keep crypto transactions private. Some X users supported the move, while others did not appreciate it that much. One X user argued that keeping the transactions would encourage money laundering. Another user even asked if they could get their taxes back. A user named Charles Keller even suggested that digital assets eventually can lead to the dollar‚Äôs fall, saying they already see signs of possible instability. Meanwhile, one stated that it would be impossible to let crypto stay private. Several commentators, however, thanked the Tennessee Representative, asking him to continue with the good work. Others expressed happiness that the White House is working closely with the Representatives. KEY Difference Wire helps crypto brands break through and dominate headlines fast

HEADLINE: Thailand Crypto Sandbox: Unlocking Revolutionary Digital Payments for Tourists
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Thailand Crypto Sandbox: Unlocking Revolutionary Digital Payments for Tourists Imagine stepping off the plane in Thailand, ready to explore its stunning beaches and vibrant culture, but instead of fumbling for local currency, you seamlessly convert your digital assets into Thai Baht right on your phone. This isn‚Äôt a futuristic dream; it‚Äôs becoming a reality. Thailand is launching a groundbreaking Thailand Crypto Sandbox designed specifically for tourists, signaling a new era for digital finance in one of the world‚Äôs most beloved travel destinations. This innovative move aims to blend the convenience of cryptocurrencies with the traditional tourism experience, making travel smoother and more modern for visitors. Thailand Crypto Sandbox: A Gateway to Digital Tourism Thailand, a nation celebrated for its hospitality and beautiful landscapes, is now stepping onto the global stage as a pioneer in digital finance innovation for tourism. The country‚Äôs Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the central bank are spearheading a new regulatory sandbox. This initiative is a controlled environment where foreign tourists can convert their cryptocurrencies into Thai Baht for local spending. The goal is clear: to leverage digital assets to boost the vital tourism sector, which is a significant pillar of Thailand‚Äôs economy. This sandbox will operate through licensed platforms and regulated e-money services. While direct crypto payments for goods and services remain prohibited, the ability to convert crypto into fiat currency on demand is a massive leap forward. It addresses a key pain point for international travelers: currency exchange. By offering a secure and regulated channel for Thailand Crypto Sandbox participants, the nation hopes to attract a new wave of tech-savvy tourists and enhance their overall travel experience. It‚Äôs about making transactions simpler and more efficient, reducing reliance on traditional banking hours or physical exchange booths. Seamless Crypto to Baht Conversion: How Will It Work? The core of this exciting initiative is the Crypto to Baht Conversion process. For foreign tourists, the mechanism is designed to be user-friendly and secure. Here‚Äôs a breakdown of how it‚Äôs expected to function: Licensed Platforms: Tourists will use approved, licensed cryptocurrency platforms or digital asset exchanges operating within Thailand. These platforms will be under the strict oversight of the SEC and the central bank, ensuring compliance and security. E-Money Services Integration: Once converted, the Thai Baht will be transferred to regulated e-money services or digital wallets. These services are widely accepted across Thailand, from major retailers to local markets, making spending convenient. No Direct Crypto Payments: It‚Äôs crucial to understand that this is not about paying directly with Bitcoin or Ethereum at a street vendor. Instead, it‚Äôs about converting your crypto into usable Thai Baht, which then functions like any other digital payment or cash. This distinction helps manage regulatory risks while still providing the benefit of using digital assets. The benefits of this seamless Crypto to Baht Conversion are numerous. Tourists can potentially avoid traditional foreign exchange fees, benefit from competitive exchange rates offered by regulated platforms, and enjoy the convenience of not carrying large amounts of cash. It also provides a level of security, as digital transactions are traceable and less susceptible to theft than physical cash. This innovation could redefine how modern travelers manage their finances abroad. Boosting Thailand Tourism: A Vision for the Future The primary driver behind the Thailand Tourism Boost initiative is economic revitalization. Tourism is a cornerstone of Thailand‚Äôs economy, contributing significantly to its GDP and employment. By embracing digital finance, Thailand aims to: Attract a New Demographic: The global cryptocurrency community is growing, comprising individuals who are often digitally native and seek convenience. By offering crypto-friendly solutions, Thailand positions itself as a forward-thinking destination for this lucrative market segment. Enhance Competitiveness: In an increasingly competitive global tourism market, innovation is key. This sandbox provides Thailand with a unique selling proposition, differentiating it from countries that have not yet embraced digital assets in a regulated manner. Increase Spending Efficiency: By making it easier for tourists to access and spend local currency, the initiative could encourage higher spending, benefiting local businesses, hotels, and service providers across the country. This strategic move is not just about short-term gains; it‚Äôs about solidifying Thailand‚Äôs position as a modern, digitally advanced travel hub. The government sees this as an investment in the future of its tourism industry, adapting to the evolving preferences of international travelers and ensuring a sustainable Th
TAGS: Crypto News|Blockchain Regulations|Crypto Tourism|digital finance|Thailand Crypto|Tourist Payments

HEADLINE: Hedge Funds Are Dumping Bank Stocks and Piling Into One Sector, Says Goldman Sachs: Report
SUMMARY: Wall Street titan Goldman Sachs says hedge funds are cutting back investments in bank stocks. Citing data from Goldman Sachs prime brokerage desk, Reuters reports hedge funds dumped bank stocks for the second straight week and bought consumer staple stocks at the fastest pace in nearly two years. The funds are exiting long positions in US banks and global financial services companies while adding short positions on European financial stocks. Goldman says banks, financial services firms and insurance companies were net sold while those involved in trading and consumer finance were net bought. The moves come as Wall Street‚Äôs record rally is set to be put to the test this week, as major banks release their second-quarter earnings reports. Meanwhile, hedge funds are buying consumer staples, which include food, beverages and tobacco that tend to be insulated from economic downturns because they are essential items. Goldman says this is the most net-bought stock sector at the Goldman Sachs prime brokerage desk this month. HEADLINE: Ethereum ETF: BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA Witnesses Colossal $489M Inflow, Signaling Historic Shift
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Ethereum ETF: BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA Witnesses Colossal $489M Inflow, Signaling Historic Shift The world of digital assets is buzzing with excitement, and for good reason! The launch of spot Ethereum ETFs has been a highly anticipated event, and BlackRock‚Äôs ETHA has just delivered a performance that has sent ripples across the entire crypto ecosystem. On July 16, this prominent Ethereum ETF recorded an astounding net inflow of $489.14 million, equivalent to 148,585 ETH. This wasn‚Äôt just another good day; it marked ETHA‚Äôs highest daily inflow since its inception, with trading volume soaring to a record $1.8 billion. This colossal surge signals a pivotal moment for institutional crypto adoption and could have a significant ETH market impact. BlackRock ETHA: A New Benchmark for Institutional Interest BlackRock, one of the world‚Äôs largest asset managers, entering the crypto space with a spot Ethereum ETF was always going to be a game-changer. Their reputation and vast network bring an unparalleled level of legitimacy and accessibility to digital assets for traditional investors. The recent inflow figures for BlackRock ETHA aren‚Äôt just numbers; they represent a powerful vote of confidence from institutional players who are increasingly recognizing the potential of Ethereum. Record-Breaking Performance: The $489.14 million net inflow on July 16 surpassed all previous daily records for ETHA, showcasing rapidly accelerating interest. Massive Trading Volume: A concurrent trading volume of $1.8 billion further underscores the high liquidity and active participation in this specific Ethereum ETF. The BlackRock Effect: BlackRock‚Äôs involvement provides a stamp of approval that resonates deeply with traditional financial institutions, often leading to a domino effect of further investment. While net flow data for other spot ETH ETFs is still awaited, ETHA‚Äôs performance alone paints a compelling picture of growing institutional appetite for Ethereum. Understanding the Significance of Spot ETH Inflows What exactly do these massive spot ETH inflows mean, and why are they so important? When an ETF experiences a net inflow, it means that investors are buying more shares of the ETF than they are selling. To accommodate this demand, the ETF issuer (in this case, BlackRock) must acquire more of the underlying asset ‚Äì actual Ethereum ‚Äì from the open market. This direct buying pressure can have a profound effect on the asset‚Äôs price and market dynamics. Consider the trajectory of spot Bitcoin ETFs earlier this year. Their successful launch and subsequent inflows were significant drivers of Bitcoin‚Äôs price rally, validating the concept of accessible crypto investment vehicles for a broader audience. The current trend with Ethereum ETFs, particularly BlackRock ETHA, suggests a similar pattern is emerging for the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization. The consistent flow of capital into these regulated investment products indicates a long-term commitment from sophisticated investors who seek exposure to Ethereum without the complexities of direct crypto ownership. This shift from speculative retail interest to sustained institutional demand is a hallmark of market maturation. The Accelerating Trend of Institutional Crypto Investment The record inflows into BlackRock ETHA are not an isolated event but rather a clear indicator of a broader, accelerating trend: the mainstreaming of institutional crypto investment. For years, digital assets were largely viewed with skepticism by traditional finance. However, the maturation of the market, clearer regulatory frameworks (albeit still evolving), and the undeniable performance of cryptocurrencies have shifted perceptions. Institutions are now looking beyond Bitcoin to other established cryptocurrencies like Ethereum, recognizing its foundational role in decentralized finance (DeFi), NFTs, and the broader Web3 ecosystem. Ethereum‚Äôs robust developer community, ongoing technological upgrades (like the transition to Proof-of-Stake), and its utility as a programmable blockchain make it an attractive long-term investment. This wave of institutional capital brings with it not just liquidity but also increased credibility, improved infrastructure, and potentially greater price stability as the market becomes less reliant on purely retail sentiment. It‚Äôs a testament to the fact that digital assets are no longer a niche curiosity but a legitimate asset class being integrated into diversified investment portfolios. What Does This Mean for the ETH Market Impact? The immediate and long-term ETH market impact of such significant inflows from an Ethereum ETF like ETHA could be multifaceted: Price Appreciation: Direct buying pressure from the ETF on the open market can lead to an increase in Ethereum‚Äôs price. Sustained inflows suggest a strong underlying demand that could support upward price momentum. Increased Liquidity: As more institutions participate through ETFs, the overall liq

HEADLINE: Coinbase Climbs App Store Rankings as Retail Interest Debate Rekindles
SUMMARY: Coinbase has surged to rank 137 in the US Apple App Store, a notable jump often seen as an early signal of rising retail interest in crypto markets. According to Sensor Tower data, the exchange‚Äôs ranking has climbed 65% over the past month, rising from 386 to 137 while Bitcoin has gained 10% during the same period. Historically, Coinbase app downloads have mirrored crypto movements . During past bull markets, Coinbase consistently entered the top 175 of app store charts, whereas ranks below 500 often aligned with prolonged bear markets. Bitcoin‚Äôs recent surge to a new all-time high of $122,884, currently trading around $118,294, has fueled speculation that retail investors might be returning. Mixed Signals on Retail Return The crypto community remains divided on whether retail is truly coming back. Crypto analyst Tony Edwards noted on X that retail is ‚Äúdefinitely starting to come back in,‚Äù citing a spike in his YouTube analytics. Similarly, Lab4Crypto remarked that ‚Äúthe crowd is slowly returning,‚Äù urging investors not to miss out if this marks the beginning of a new retail wave. However, some remain cautious. Andr√© Dragosch, head of research at Bitwise, argued that ‚Äúretail is almost nowhere to be found,‚Äù pointing to stagnant Google search interest for ‚ÄúBitcoin‚Äù despite its price surging to new highs. Crypto trader Elisa echoed this sentiment, highlighting that Google Trends data for ‚Äúcrypto‚Äù remains far below the peaks seen during the 2021 bull market. Traditional Indicators May Be Losing Reliability While retail interest is often gauged through app downloads and search trends, some industry observers warn these metrics may not reflect the complete picture in the current market. The rise of spot Bitcoin and Ether ETFs has provided retail investors with alternative avenues for crypto exposure, potentially reducing the reliance on direct exchange sign-ups. Since their January 2024 launch, spot Bitcoin ETFs have amassed $53.05 billion in inflows , while spot Ether ETFs, launched in July 2024, have attracted approximately $6 billion, according to Farside data. Bitfinex analysts noted on Tuesday that new Bitcoin buyers appear to be price-agnostic, with wallets holding between 1 and 100 BTC accumulating around 19,300 BTC monthly, outpacing the 13,400 BTC monthly issuance post-April 2024 halving. The post Coinbase Climbs App Store Rankings as Retail Interest Debate Rekindles appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

Bitcoin‚Äôs recent surge to a new all-time high of $122,884, currently trading around $118,294, has fueled speculation that retail investors might be returning. Mixed Signals on Retail Return The crypto community remains divided on whether retail is truly coming back. Crypto analyst Tony Edwards noted on X that retail is ‚Äúdefinitely starting to come back in,‚Äù citing a spike in his YouTube analytics. Similarly, Lab4Crypto remarked that ‚Äúthe crowd is slowly returning,‚Äù urging investors not to miss out if this marks the beginning of a new retail wave. However, some remain cautious. Andr√© Dragosch, head of research at Bitwise, argued that ‚Äúretail is almost nowhere to be found,‚Äù pointing to stagnant Google search interest for ‚ÄúBitcoin‚Äù despite its price surging to new highs. Crypto trader Elisa echoed this sentiment, highlighting that Google Trends data for ‚Äúcrypto‚Äù remains far below the peaks seen during the 2021 bull market. Traditional Indicators May Be Losing Reliability While retail interest is often gauged through app downloads and search trends, some industry observers warn these metrics may not reflect the complete picture in the current market. The rise of spot Bitcoin and Ether ETFs has provided retail investors with alternative avenues for crypto exposure, potentially reducing the reliance on direct exchange sign-ups. Since their January 2024 launch, spot Bitcoin ETFs have amassed $53.05 billion in inflows , while spot Ether ETFs, launched in July 2024, have attracted approximately $6 billion, according to Farside data. Bitfinex analysts noted on Tuesday that new Bitcoin buyers appear to be price-agnostic, with wallets holding between 1 and 100 BTC accumulating around 19,300 BTC monthly, outpacing the 13,400 BTC monthly issuance post-April 2024 halving. The post Coinbase Climbs App Store Rankings as Retail Interest Debate Rekindles appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

HEADLINE: Top Crypto Analyst Confirms Altcoin Season: ‚ÄòIt Starts Now‚Äô
SUMMARY: Renowned crypto analyst Josh Olszewicz has declared what many crypto traders have long been waiting for: Altcoin Season has officially begun. In a market breakdown released on July 16, Olszewicz dismissed any lingering doubt about the current market structure, arguing that the conditions for outsized altcoin performance are firmly in place. Crypto Alert: Altcoin Season Is Here ‚ÄúFor years, you‚Äôve had people telling you, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs an alt season.‚Äô The funny thing is, when alt season is actually here, you don‚Äôt need anybody to tell you‚Äîit‚Äôs obvious,‚Äù Olszewicz said, emphasizing that current price action across major alts and risk assets leaves little room for ambiguity. Related Reading: Crypto Relief: House Advances GENIUS, CLARITY, Anti-CBDC Bills After Narrow Vote According to Olszewicz, Bitcoin remains the backbone of the crypto market, consolidating near $120,000 at the yearly pivot with ‚Äúplenty of room to go‚Äù on technicals. He acknowledged that BTC‚Äôs strength underpins the entire market cycle, but the focus has shifted to the explosive moves underway in altcoins. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs be honest‚Äîyou‚Äôre here because you want to outperform BTC by 2x to 5x. That‚Äôs the goal,‚Äù he said. Ethereum sits at the center of this rotation, breaking out decisively from $2,200 to above $3,200. ‚ÄúETH has had quite the breakout. It‚Äôs above the next pivot at $3,200. I don‚Äôt need the cloud to tell me this is bullish,‚Äù Olszewicz noted, pointing to technical tailwinds and regulatory clarity surrounding staking and ETFs as additional catalysts. While ETH advocates have renewed confidence, Olszewicz cautioned against overconfidence: ‚ÄúBe careful drinking the Kool-Aid. ETH could go to $10K, but I think it‚Äôll struggle at $5K. For July, $4K looks realistic‚Äîbut that‚Äôs already nearly 4x from the April bottom.‚Äù The analyst also flagged Solana as a key player for those who missed the early moves in BTC and ETH. ‚ÄúSol is starting to look better and better here, approaching the yearly pivot. If it breaks above $177, watch out,‚Äù he said, although he warned that the SOL/ETH chart still shows weakness. Other strong setups include Sui, Avalanche, and meme coins like Dogecoin and Pepe, which have already logged triple-digit percentage gains in recent weeks from their respective bottom. Still, Olszewicz urged traders to temper expectations for an uninterrupted melt-up. Historically, August and September have been weaker months for crypto, and he anticipates potential sharp corrections in alts. ‚ÄúMaybe we don‚Äôt see huge continuation in those months. We could even get negative 25% days on alts‚Äîjust randomly, for whatever reason. You know that‚Äôs coming,‚Äù he said. Related Reading: Crypto Bulls Rejoice: Congresswoman Confirms Powell‚Äôs Imminent Firing Despite these caveats, the broader outlook remains decisively bullish. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard to throw a dart and miss at this point in the market. Everything looks good. If you‚Äôre in positions that aren‚Äôt working here, you need to ask yourself why,‚Äù Olszewicz added. He highlighted that even NFTs, long considered a proxy for speculative appetite, are surging again, with collections like Pudgy Penguins and Bored Apes seeing multi-week highs. As for the much-debated ETH/BTC pair, Olszewicz reminded traders that relative value matters. ‚ÄúThis is why everyone came here‚Äîfor this chart. We‚Äôre still far below the cloud, at levels last seen in 2020. The target for mean reversion is 0.038. Until ETH/BTC is above the weekly cloud, don‚Äôt get carried away with the ETH-maxi stuff,‚Äù he said, adding that the long-term bear trend could persist into 2026 despite short-term strength. Olszewicz closed with a note of caution for overleveraged traders. ‚ÄúThis is a marathon, not a sprint. Don‚Äôt lose your shirt on 50x leverage when there‚Äôs so much market left to trade,‚Äù he warned. With total altcoin market capitalization approaching critical resistance near $1.5 trillion and sentiment flashing risk-on across the board, the message from one of crypto‚Äôs most followed analysts is clear: Altcoin Season isn‚Äôt coming‚Äîit‚Äôs already here. At press time, the total crypto market cap surged to 3.75 trillion. Featured image created with DALL.E, chart from TradingView.com
TAGS: Cryptocurrency Market News|altcoin news|Altcoin Season|altcoins|crypto|crypto news|cryptocurrencies

HEADLINE: Crypto Week In Jeopardy: Legislative Hurdles Threaten Progress On Regulation Bills
SUMMARY: The future of three critical crypto bills faced uncertainty late Wednesday as conservative House Republicans united to oppose the legislation, bringing the process to a standstill. According to CNBC information, fresh opposition emerged from a new faction of Republicans who resisted ‚Äúlast-minute changes‚Äù aimed at appeasing earlier holdouts, complicating negotiations that are ongoing. House GOP Divisions As of late Wednesday, more than half a dozen Republicans reportedly joined Democrats in voting against allowing two of the regulation bills to advance in their current forms. This impasse has raised concerns about the ability of House Republicans to reconcile their differing views on crypto regulation, even though the bills generally enjoy broad support. House Speaker Mike Johnson from Louisiana can afford to lose only a few Republican votes to pass the measures through a party-line vote, making the current stalemate particularly precarious. The situation also casts doubt on President Donald Trump‚Äôs influence within the party. After a meeting in the Oval Office on Tuesday evening with a group of conservative Republicans, Trump announced that they had reached an agreement to support the rules necessary for moving forward. However, Wednesday‚Äôs developments signify a setback for the crypto industry, which had hoped for legislative progress during what had been dubbed ‚ÄúCrypto Week.‚Äù Alternative Strategies For Crypto Legislation Opposition on Wednesday came not only from conservative hardliners but also from members of key committees involved in drafting the legislation. Among the bills at stake is the GENIUS Act, which successfully passed the Senate in June, alongside the CLARITY Act and another bill restricting the Federal Reserve from establishing a central bank digital currency (CBDC). As negotiations continue, Republican leadership is reportedly contemplating alternative strategies, including adding the central bank digital currency ban to an unrelated must-pass bill, a move reported by Punchbowl. Market journalist Eleanor Terret noted on social media that Senate Republicans are hoping for some progress from the House to maintain momentum for crypto legislation, although they want to avoid another failed vote. Some of the Republicans who initially opposed the bills but later shifted their stance after meeting with Trump did so on the condition that strong anti-central bank digital currency provisions would be integrated into the CLARITY Act, as the GENIUS Act is not open for amendments. However, the authors of CLARITY, along with several other committee members, have expressed concerns that combining these two initiatives could jeopardize the bipartisan market structure legislation they have worked on for months. One Republican holdout, Representative Chip Roy, expressed skepticism about the agreements made previously, suggesting that the consensus reached in the White House meeting may no longer hold. In light of the evolving situation, GOP leaders are now pushing to incorporate anti-CBDC language into the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) as another potential pathway for advancing the legislation. Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com
TAGS: Crypto News|CLARITY Act|crypto|crypto bills|crypto news|crypto regulation|Crypto Week|Cryptocurrency|DeFi|digital currency|GENIUS Act|US Crypto Week
